00013 //These functions are used by the ConfigHandler as command switches
00014 class EnableModule{
00015   const bool _enable;
00016 public:
00017   EnableModule(const bool& enable) : _enable(enable) {}
00018   int operator()(const char* modname){
00019     EventHandler* h = EventHandler::GetInstance();
00020     BaseModule* mod = (BaseModule*)(h->GetParameter(modname));
00021     if(!mod) {
00022       Message(ERROR)<<"Unknown module "<<modname<<std::endl;
00023       throw std::invalid_argument("Unknown module");
00024     }
00025     mod->enabled = _enable;
00026     return 0;
00027   }
00028 };
00029 
00030 int ListModules(const char*){
00031   std::cout<<"The available modules are:\n";
00032   const std::vector<BaseModule*>* modules = 
00033     EventHandler::GetInstance()->GetListOfModules();
00034   for(size_t i=0; i< modules->size(); i++){
00035     std::cout<<"\t"<<modules->at(i)->GetName()<<std::endl;
00036   }
00037   exit(0);
00038 }

00041 
00042 EventHandler::EventHandler() : 
00043   ParameterList("modules","Takes raw events and delivers it to all enabled modules for processing"), 
00044   _current_event(), _is_initialized(false), run_id(-1)
00045 {
00046   ConfigHandler* config = ConfigHandler::GetInstance();
00047   config->RegisterParameter(this->GetDefaultKey(),*this);
00048   config->RegisterParameter(_dbinfo.GetDefaultKey(), _dbinfo);
00049   RegisterParameter("access_database", _access_database=false,
00050                     "Do we query the database for run/calibration info?");
00051   RegisterParameter("fail_on_bad_cal", _fail_on_bad_cal=false,
00052                     "Fail to initialize if unable to  find calibration data");
00053   RegisterParameter("run_parallel", _run_parallel=false,
00054                     "Do we process modules in series, or give them threads?");
00055   config->AddCommandSwitch(' ',"enable","enable <module>",
00056                            EnableModule(true),"module");
00057   config->AddCommandSwitch(' ',"disable","disable <module>",
00058                            EnableModule(false),"module");
00059   config->AddCommandSwitch(' ',"list-modules","list the available modules",
00060                            ListModules);
00061   config->AddCommandSwitch(' ',"no-db","Skip attempts to access database",
00062                            CommandSwitch::SetValue<bool>(_access_database,false)
00063                            );
00064   
00065 }

00068 EventHandler::~EventHandler()
00069 {
00070   if(_is_initialized)
00071     Finalize();
00072   for(size_t i=0; i<_modules.size(); i++){
00073     delete _modules[i];
00074   }
00075   _modules.clear();
00076   
00077 }
00078 
00079 EventHandler* EventHandler::GetInstance()
00080 {
00081   static EventHandler handler;
00082   return &handler;
00083 }
00084 
00085 int EventHandler::AddModule(BaseModule* mod, bool processme, bool registerme)
00086 {
00087   if(!mod)
00088     return -1;
00089   //make sure module is not already considered
00090   if(std::find(_modules.begin(),_modules.end(),mod)==_modules.end()){
00091     _modules.push_back(mod);
00092   }
00093   if(processme)
00094     _processing_modules.push_back(mod);
00095   if(registerme)
00096     RegisterParameter(mod->GetName(), *mod);
00097   return _modules.size();
00098 }
00099 
00100 BaseModule* EventHandler::GetModule(const std::string& modname)
00101 {
00102   for(size_t i=0; i<_modules.size(); ++i){
00103     if(_modules[i]->GetName() == modname)
00104       return _modules[i];
00105   }
00106   //if we get here, module is not known
00107   return 0;
00108 }
00109 
00110 int EventHandler::Initialize()
00111 {
00112   if(_is_initialized) return 1;
00113   Message(DEBUG)<<"EventHandler::Initialize() called with  "<<_modules.size()
00114                 <<" registered modules...\n";
00115   _is_initialized = true;
00116   
00117   //initialize the runinfo
00118   //try to load the info from a saved cfg file, only if not in this file
00119   if(_dbinfo.channels.empty()){
00120     Message(DEBUG)<<"Searching for runinfo in saved cfg file.\n";
00121     ConfigHandler::GetInstance()->LoadParameterList(&_dbinfo);
00122   }
00123   //if we couldn't load the runid from the saved file, see if it was set already
00124   if(_dbinfo.runid == -1){
00125     _dbinfo.runid = run_id;
00126   }
00127   //the database info is the best source
00128   if(_dbinfo.runid > -1 && _access_database){
00129     Message(DEBUG)<<"Loading runinfo from database.\n";
00130     bool sync = _dbinfo.SyncWithDatabase();
00131     if(!sync)
00132       Message(WARNING)<<"Unable to load runinfo from database.\n";
00133   }
00134   //try to load calibration from the db also 
00135   if(!_dbinfo.channels.empty() && _access_database){
00136     Message(DEBUG)<<"Loading calibration factors from database.\n";
00137     int good_cal = _dbinfo.LoadCalibrationInfo();
00138     if(_fail_on_bad_cal && good_cal < (int)_dbinfo.channels.size()){
00139       Message(ERROR)<<"Unable to load calibration data for all channels\n";
00140       return -1;
00141     }    
00142   }
00143   
00144   //try to load campaign info from the database 
00145   if(_access_database && _dbinfo.starttime.t>0){
00146     Message(DEBUG)<<"EventHandler::Initialize(): "
00147                   <<"Loading campaign info from database.\n";
00148     int good_pmts = _cpinfo.LoadCampaignInfo(_dbinfo.starttime.t);
00149     if (good_pmts < (int)_dbinfo.channels.size())
00150       Message(WARNING)<<"EventHandler::Initialize(): "
00151                       <<"Unable to load campaign info from database.\n";
00152   }
00153   
00154   
00155   //this info is in the raw file, so reset it:
00156   _dbinfo.ResetRunStats();
00157   
00158   //first initialize all enabled modules
00159   std::set<std::string> enabled_modules;
00160   
00161   for(size_t i = 0; i<_modules.size(); i++){
00162     BaseModule* mod = _modules[i];
00163     if(!mod->enabled){
00164       Message(DEBUG)<<"Module "<<mod->GetName()<<" was disabled manually.\n";
00165       continue;
00166     }
00167     //see if all our dependencies are enabled 
00168     const std::set<std::string>* deps = mod->GetDependencies();
00169     std::set<std::string>::const_iterator dep = deps->begin();
00170     for( ; dep != deps->end(); ++dep){
00171       if( enabled_modules.find(*dep) == enabled_modules.end()){
00172         mod->enabled = false;
00173         Message(DEBUG)<<"Module "<<mod->GetName()<<" was disabled by "
00174                       <<"failed dependency "<<*dep<<".\n";
00175         break;
00176       }
00177     }
00178     if(!mod->enabled)
00179       continue;
00180     //if we get here, the module is enabled and ready to initialize
00181     Message(DEBUG)<<"Module "<<mod->GetName()<<" is enabled. Initializing...\n";
00182     enabled_modules.insert(mod->GetName());
00183     if(mod->Initialize()){
00184       Message(CRITICAL)<<"Unable to initialize module "<<mod->GetName()
00185                        <<"; aborting.\n";
00186       _is_initialized = false;
00187       return 1;
00188     }
00189     if(_run_parallel){
00190       //give this module an AsyncEventHandler
00191       AsyncEventHandler* ah = new AsyncEventHandler;
00192       ah->SetBlockingStatus(true);
00193       ah->AddModule(mod,false);
00194       if(_para_handlers.size()==0)
00195         AddAsyncReceiver(ah);
00196       else
00197         _para_handlers.back()->AddReceiver(ah);
00198       ah->StartRunning();
00199       _para_handlers.push_back(ah);
00200     }
00201   }
00202   
00203   return 0;
00204 }
00205 
00206 int EventHandler::Process(RawEventPtr raw)
00207 {
00208   if(!raw){
00209     Message(ERROR)<<"Attempted to process empty event pointer.\n";
00210     return 1;
00211   }
00212   EventPtr evt(new Event(raw));
00213   return Process(evt);
00214 }
00215 
00216 int EventHandler::Process(EventPtr evt)
00217 {  
00218   
00219   if(!_is_initialized) {
00220     Message(ERROR)<<"Attempted to process events before initialization!\n";
00221     throw std::runtime_error("EventHandler::uninitialized process request");
00222     return 1;
00223   }
00224   
00225   int proc_fail = 0;
00226   
00227   _current_event = evt;
00228   //set the run id here
00229   _current_event->GetEventData()->run_id = run_id;
00230   if(!_run_parallel){
00231     std::vector<BaseModule*>::iterator it;
00232     for(it=_processing_modules.begin(); it!=_processing_modules.end(); it++){
00233       BaseModule* mod = *it;
00234       if(mod->enabled){
00235         //Message(DEBUG)<<"Processing module "<<mod->GetName()<<std::endl;
00236         proc_fail += mod->HandleEvent(_current_event);
00237       }
00238     }
00239   }
00240   for(size_t i=0; i < _async_receivers.size(); ++i)
00241     _async_receivers[i]->Process(evt);
00242 
00243   return proc_fail;
00244 }
00245 
00246 int EventHandler::Finalize()
00247 {
00248   if(!_is_initialized) {
00249     Message(WARNING)<<"EventHandler::Finalize() called uninitialized!\n";
00250   }
00251   _is_initialized = false;
00252   //make sure the modules have finished
00253   for(size_t i=0; i<_async_receivers.size(); ++i){
00254     _async_receivers[i]->Process(EventPtr());
00255   }
00256   if(_run_parallel){
00257     for(size_t i=0; i<_para_handlers.size(); ++i){
00258       //this should block until done processing
00259       _para_handlers[i]->Process(EventPtr());
00260       _para_handlers[i]->StopRunning();
00261       delete _para_handlers[i];
00262       //note: assume no one has messed with the receiver list since Initialize
00263       if(i==0)
00264         _async_receivers.pop_back();
00265     }
00266   }
00267   int final_fail = 0;
00268   Message(DEBUG)<<"Finalizing "<<_modules.size()<<" modules..."<<std::endl;
00269   //finalization should go in opposite order of initialization
00270   //but that messes up root file writing, so go in same order...                
00271   std::vector<BaseModule*>::iterator it;
00272   for(it = _modules.begin(); it != _modules.end(); it++){
00273     BaseModule* mod = *it;
00274     if(mod->enabled){
00275       Message(DEBUG)<<"Finalizing module "<<mod->GetName()<<std::endl;
00276       final_fail += mod->Finalize();
00277     }
00278   }
00279   //reset the run info
00280   _dbinfo.Init(true);
00281   Message(DEBUG)<<"Done finalizing modules.\n";
00282   if(final_fail)
00283     Message(WARNING)<<"Finalization returned error code "<<final_fail<<"\n";
00284   return final_fail;
00285 }   
00286  
00287 int EventHandler::SetRunIDFromFilename(const std::string& filename)
00288 {
00289   run_id = -1;
00290   //see if the filename matches the pattern *Run######.out.gz
00291   std::string filepart = filename;
00292   //remove any trailing '/'
00293   while(*filepart.rbegin() == '/')
00294     filepart.resize(filepart.size()-1);
00295   size_t basept = filepart.find_last_of('/');
00296   if( basept == std::string::npos) 
00297     basept = 0;
00298   else 
00299     basept++;
00300   filepart = filepart.substr(basept);
00301   size_t runpt = filepart.find("Run");
00302   if( runpt != std::string::npos && filepart.size()>runpt+8){
00303     run_id = atoi(filepart.substr(runpt+3,6).c_str());
00304   }
00305   else{
00306     //might be of the form <name>_yymmddHHMM.<suffix>
00307     size_t underscore = filepart.find_last_of('_');
00308     if(underscore != std::string::npos && filepart.size() > underscore+10){
00309       std::stringstream s(filepart.substr(underscore+1,10));
00310       s >> run_id;
00311     }
00312   }
00313 
00314   Message(INFO)<<"Setting runid to "<<run_id<<" based on filename "<<filename
00315                <<std::endl;
00316  return run_id;
00317 }
